facts.text: The national game, Buzkashi, involves players on horses dragging a goat carcass.
Home to the world's oldest known oil paintings (dating to 650 AD).
New Year's is celebrated on the first day of spring (Nowruz).
Lapis lazuli has been mined here for over 6,000 years.
Poetry is a massive part of the culture; 'poetry night' is a common pastime.
There are over 173,000 concrete bunkers scattered across the country.
Nodding your head means 'no' and shaking it means 'yes'.
Mother Teresa was of Albanian descent.
Xhiro is a tradition where everyone walks outdoors at sunset to socialize.
It was the world's first atheist state (declared in 1967).
The largest country in Africa by land area.
The Sahara Desert covers more than 80% of the land.
Home to the Fennec fox, the national animal.
It has 7 UNESCO World Heritage sites, including Roman ruins like Timgad.
Petrol is cheaper than water in some areas.
The only country in the world with two princes: the President of France and a Spanish Bishop.
It has no airport and no train station.
The capital, Andorra la Vella, is the highest in Europe.
It has never been in a war in 1,000 years.
Home to one of the highest life expectancies in the world.
The capital, Luanda, is often ranked the most expensive city for expats.
Kizomba music and dance originated here.
Home to the Giant Sable Antelope, thought to be extinct until recently.
The Kalandula Falls are one of the largest waterfalls in Africa.
The country is twice the size of Texas.
It has 365 beaches, one for every day of the year.
Mount Obama was named after the US President (briefly).
Home to the Frigate Bird sanctuary.
Cricket is the national sport and a religion here.
There are no rivers on the island of Antigua.
The birthplace of Tango.
Has the highest number of psychiatrists per capita in the world.
Home to the southernmost city in the world, Ushuaia.
The name comes from the Latin word for silver ('argentum').
Pope Francis used to work as a nightclub bouncer in Buenos Aires.
The first country to adopt Christianity as its state religion (301 AD).
Chess is a mandatory subject in schools.
Home to the world's oldest winery (6,100 years old).
The national symbol, Mount Ararat, is actually located in Turkey.
The apricot is the national fruit.
Home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest living structure.
There are more kangaroos than humans.
The country is wider than the moon.
It has over 10,000 beaches; you could visit one a day for 27 years.
They once lost a war against Emus.
Home to the oldest zoo in the world (Tiergarten SchÃ¶nbrunn).
Arnold Schwarzenegger was born here.
Postcards were invented here.
The sewing machine was invented here by Josef Madersperger.
About 62% of the country is covered by the Alps.
Known as the 'Land of Fire' due to natural gas vents.
Pancakes are often cooked on the back of a shovel here.
Home to the first modern oil well (1846).
Tea is the national drink, served in pear-shaped glasses.
Neft DaÅŸlarÄ± is a full city built on stilts over the sea.
Home to the swimming pigs of Exuma.
It has the clearest water on Earth with visibility over 200 feet.
It actually snowed here once in 1977.
Once a haven for pirates like Blackbeard.
The name comes from Spanish 'baja mar' (shallow sea).
Home to the 'Tree of Life', a 400-year-old tree in the desert with no water source.
It is an archipelago of 33 islands.
It was the site of the ancient Dilmun civilization.
Weekends are Friday and Saturday.
The British Grand Prix of the Middle East is held here.
It has six seasons, including 'Monsoon' and 'Late Autumn'.
Home to the world's longest natural sea beach (Cox's Bazar).
The Royal Bengal Tiger is the national animal.
More people live here than in Russia.
It is the river delta capital of the world.
The birthplace of Rihanna.
Rum was invented here in 1703.
The country's name means 'The Bearded Ones' (after fig trees).
It has never been invaded by a foreign power.
Flying fish is the national dish.
Home to the last dictatorship in Europe.
40% of the country is covered in forests.
Potatoes are considered 'second bread' here.
The BelAZ 75710, the world's largest dump truck, is made here.
Bisons (Wisents) still roam the primeval forests.
Produces over 220,000 tons of chocolate per year.
French Fries were invented here (not France).
Home to the Smurfs.
Belgium holds the record for the longest time without a government (589 days).
Billiards balls were originally made here.
The only Central American country where English is the official language.
Home to the Great Blue Hole, a giant marine sinkhole.
It was the center of the Mayan Empire.
Jaguar crossing signs are common on highways.
Their currency features the Queen of England.
The birthplace of Voodoo religion.
Home to the 'Venice of Africa' (GanviÃ©), a village on stilts.
It was formerly known as the Kingdom of Dahomey.
The Amazons of Dahomey were an all-female military regiment here.
Snakes are revered, especially pythons.
Measures success by 'Gross National Happiness' instead of GDP.
The only carbon-negative country in the world.
Plastic bags and tobacco are completely banned.
TV and Internet were illegal until 1999.
The national animal is the Takin, a goat-antelope hybrid.
Home to the Salar de Uyuni, the world's largest salt flat.
The capital, La Paz, is the highest administrative capital in the world.
They have a navy despite being landlocked.
Guinea pig (Cuy) is a traditional delicacy.
Zebra crossings are often manned by people in zebra costumes.
Sarajevo hosted the 1984 Winter Olympics.
Known as the 'Heart Shaped Land' due to its borders.
Home to one of the last jungles in Europe (PeruÄ‡ica).
The Stari Most bridge is a UNESCO site that divers jump from.
Coffee drinking is a massive ritual here.
Africa's oldest continuous democracy.
Home to the world's largest concentration of African elephants.
Nearly 40% of the land is dedicated to national parks.
The Okavango Delta can be seen from space.
A leading producer of gem-quality diamonds.
Home to the largest Japanese population outside Japan.
The Amazon River is the largest river by discharge volume.
They have won the FIFA World Cup more than any other country.
Snake Island is so dangerous civilians are banned.
Prisoners can reduce their sentence by reading books.
The Sultan was once the richest man in the world.
Citizens pay zero income tax.
The Istana Nurul Iman palace has 1,788 rooms.
Alcohol is banned publicly.
Located completely on the island of Borneo.
Produces 70% of the world's rose oil.
The oldest golden treasure in the world was found here (Varna).
Nodding means 'no' and shaking means 'yes' (like Albania).
Home to the Cyrillic alphabet origin.
Bagpipes (Gaida) are the national instrument.
The name means 'Land of Incorruptible People'.
Ouagadougou is the capital with a rhythmic name.
Known for the FESPACO film festival, Africa's largest.
White crocodiles are sacred in the town of Sabou.
Gold is the main export.
Home to Gustave, a man-eating crocodile rumored to have eaten 300 people.
Jogging in groups was once banned to prevent uprisings.
It is one of the smallest countries in Africa.
Banana beer is a traditional beverage.
The source of the Nile River is often cited here.
Also known as Cape Verde.
It is an archipelago of 10 volcanic islands.
Charles Darwin studied flora here before the Galapagos.
There are more Cabo Verdeans living abroad than in the country.
Traditional music 'Morna' was made famous by CesÃ¡ria Ã‰vora.
Home to Angkor Wat, the largest religious monument in the world.
The only national flag to feature a building.
Tarantulas are a common street food snack.
New Year is celebrated in April.
There was no money during the Khmer Rouge regime.
Known as 'Africa in Miniature' due to its diverse geography.
Home to over 250 local languages.
The Goliath Frog, the world's largest frog, lives here.
The national soccer team is the Indomitable Lions.
Features a lake (Nyos) that exploded in 1986.
Has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
Produces 70% of the world's maple syrup.
The national animal is the Beaver.
Santa Claus officially has Canadian citizenship.
It has the longest street in the world (Yonge St).
Home to the Dzanga-Sangha Special Reserve for gorillas.
It is considered the best place to stargaze in Africa due to low light pollution.
Despite immense diamond wealth, it is one of the poorest nations.
Forest elephants here are smaller than savannah elephants.
The Boali Waterfalls are 50 meters high.
The national flag is almost identical to Romania's.
Lake Chad has shrunk by 95% since 1963.
Known as the 'Dead Heart of Africa' due to its distance from the sea.
Camel racing is a popular sport.
The Kakaki is a long metal trumpet used in traditional music.
The longest and narrowest country in the world.
Home to the Atacama Desert, the driest place on Earth.
Easter Island (Rapa Nui) and its giant heads are part of Chile.
They have the world's largest swimming pool.
Produces excellent wine, especially Carmenere.
The Great Wall is over 13,000 miles long.
Pandas are considered a national treasure and are loaned, not sold.
The Forbidden City has 9,999 rooms.
Ice cream was invented here around 200 BC.
They have only one time zone despite being huge.
Produces around 70-90% of the world's emeralds.
The 'River of Five Colors' (CaÃ±o Cristales) turns red in summer.
It has the second highest biodiversity in the world.
Tejo is a national sport that involves throwing disks at gunpowder.
Shakira and Sofia Vergara are from here.
Known as the 'Perfume Isles' due to Ylang-Ylang production.
It is the only Arab country entirely in the Southern Hemisphere.
The Coelacanth fish, a 'living fossil', was found here.
It has experienced over 20 coups since independence.
Grand Comore has an active volcano, Mount Karthala.
Formerly known as Zaire.
Home to the Bonobo, the closest relative to humans.
The second largest country in Africa.
Kinshasa and Brazzaville are the closest capital cities in the world.
Musician Papa Wemba popularized the 'Sapeurs' fashion movement.
Often called 'Congo-Brazzaville' to distinguish it.
Home to the Western Lowland Gorilla.
80% of the country is covered in rainforest.
The Congo River is the deepest river in the world.
Oil is the primary export.
It has no standing army (abolished in 1948).
Home to 5% of the world's biodiversity.
Uses 99% renewable energy.
'Pura Vida' (Pure Life) is the national motto.
The necktie (cravat) was invented here by mercenaries in the 1600s.
Game of Thrones (King's Landing) was filmed in Dubrovnik.
Home to the world's smallest town, Hum, with a population of ~20.
Nikola Tesla was born in Smiljan, Croatia.
The Sea Organ in Zadar plays music via ocean waves.
Classic American cars from the 1950s are still widely used.
The recipe for Coca-Cola is illegal here (one of only two countries).
Home to the Bee Hummingbird, the world's smallest bird.
Dancing is a huge part of life; the birthplace of Salsa and Mambo.
Dominoes is considered a national pastime.
The entire city of Paphos is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Halloumi cheese originated here.
Legend says Aphrodite, goddess of love, was born here from sea foam.
It is the only foreign country to host a Royal Wedding (Richard the Lionheart).
Cats outnumber humans on the island.
Also known as the Czech Republic.
Czechs drink the most beer per capita in the world.
Prague Castle is the largest ancient castle in the world.
Soft contact lenses were invented here by Otto Wichterle.
Sugar cubes were invented here in 1843.
LEGO was invented here (the name means 'play well').
It has the two oldest amusement parks in the world (Bakken and Tivoli).
There is no word for 'please' in the Danish language.

The national flag (Dannebrog) is the oldest used flag in the world.
Home to Lake Assal, the lowest point in Africa.
Whale sharks congregate here in the Gulf of Tadjoura.
It is a major transit point for Red Sea shipping.
Khat (a stimulant plant) is widely chewed socially.
The landscape is often described as 'extraterrestrial'.
Known as the 'Nature Island of the Caribbean'.
Home to the second largest boiling lake in the world.
It has 365 rivers, one for every day of the year.
Mountain Chicken (a giant frog) is the national dish.
Filming location for 'Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest'.

Baseball is the most popular sport.

The only national flag to feature a Bible.
Invented the Merengue dance style.
Also known as Timor-Leste.
One of the world's youngest countries (independent in 2002).
Home to the Tour de Timor, one of the toughest mountain bike races.
Crocodiles are considered sacred ancestors.
Coffee is the main export and is strictly organic.
Named after the Equator, which runs through it.
Owns the GalÃ¡pagos Islands, famous for biodiversity.

Bananas are the top export.
Home to the only surviving Ancient Wonder (Great Pyramid of Giza).
The 365-day calendar was invented here.
Ancient Egyptians loved board games (like Senet).
Cats were considered sacred animals.
The Nile is the longest river in the world.
Known as the 'Land of Volcanoes'.
It is the smallest country in Central America.
Pupusas (stuffed tortillas) are the national dish.
Adopted Bitcoin as legal tender in 2021.
Surfing capital of the region due to Punta Roca waves.
The only Spanish-speaking country in Africa.
The capital (Malabo) is on an island, not the mainland.
It is one of the richest countries in Africa per capita (oil).
Home to the Goliath Frog.
The capital, Asmara, is known as 'Little Rome' for its architecture.
It has no official national language.
One of the hottest places on Earth (Danakil Depression).
Women fought alongside men in the war for independence.

Over 50% of the land is forest.
Formerly known as Swaziland.
One of the last absolute monarchies in the world.

Known for the Rhino Wars (strict anti-poaching).
The King has many wives.
The only African nation never colonized.
Coffee was discovered here (legend of Kaldi the goat herder).

Home to 'Lucy', the famous Australopithecus fossil.

Made up of 333 islands.
Rugby is the national obsession.
Firewalking originated here on the island of Beqa.
Cannibalism was practiced here until the late 19th century.
Fiji Water is their most famous export.
Ranked the happiest country in the world multiple times.
There are more saunas than cars.
Home to the Heavy Metal Knitting World Championship.

The most visited country in the world.
The Louvre is so big it would take 100 days to see every piece.

First country to ban supermarkets from throwing away food.
Produces over 400 types of cheese.
home to the 'Surfing Hippos' (they swim in the ocean).

The 'Land of the Gabons' (Portuguese coat shape).
Known for the Iboga plant, used in spiritual rituals.

Almost entirely surrounded by Senegal.
Known as the 'Smiling Coast of Africa'.
Named after the Gambia River.
Considered the birthplace of wine (8,000 years of history).
The language has its own unique alphabet.

There are over 1,500 types of beer.
The Autobahn has no speed limit in many sections.
The Christmas tree tradition started here.

Escape is not illegal (it's human nature to want freedom).

Home to Lake Volta, the world's largest man-made lake.

The birthplace of democracy, philosophy, and the Olympics.

They produce 7% of the world's marble.

Home to the giant anteater.

The only nation in all four hemispheres.
The first country to welcome the New Year.

Pronounced 'Kir-i-bas'.
